N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 9500.5 - Standards for review

State Regulations

To determine whether a project might have a significant
adverse effect upon the scenic, historic, recreational, ecological, conservational or natural resources of the area and to determine the
commercial, industrial, agricultural, residential or other benefits of the
project, the commission will consider: (a) impacts on significant scenic, historic, recreational, ecological, conservational or natural resources; (b) impacts on commercial, industrial, agricultural and residential resources; (c) impacts on local and regional economies, including tax implications and employment opportunities; (d) application and conformity to municipal
comprehensive plans, local laws and ordinances, the standards of other public
agencies or other regulations, including those of adjacent
municipalities; (e) impacts on
local services and facilities, including sewers, water supply, electricity, police, fire, schools and thoroughfares; (f) impacts on land, water and air qualities
and adjacent land uses; (g) impacts
on drainage, flooding and soil erosion; (h) impacts on visual appreciation, odor
levels and noise levels; and
(i) impacts on existing buildings and surrounding landscape. Notes
